# MCP Tool Shop - AI-Native Development Toolkit

> Production-grade MCP servers for semantic search, code analysis, AI orchestration, and multimodal generation

## Overview

The MCP Tool Shop is a curated collection of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers designed for local AI infrastructure. Each tool is built for production use with comprehensive error handling, semantic search capabilities, and modular architecture.

**Philosophy:** Syntropy above all else - systematic optimization, order, and production-ready solutions over quick fixes.

## Core Infrastructure

### Tool Compass
**Semantic MCP Tool Discovery & Orchestration**
- 115+ indexed tools across 6 backend servers
- HNSW-based semantic search with Ollama embeddings
- Progressive disclosure pattern (compass → describe → execute)
- Tool chains and workflow detection
- Analytics and hot cache optimization
- Location: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/tool-compass

### File Compass  
**Semantic File Search for AI Workstations**
- HNSW indexing with local embeddings (Ollama)
- Sub-100ms search across large codebases
- Project-aware context boundaries
- Integration with Tool Compass for unified discovery
- Location: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/file-compass

## AI Generation & Inference

### Comfy-Headless
**Production ComfyUI Client with AI Prompt Intelligence**
- Headless ComfyUI orchestration
- AI-powered prompt enhancement
- Video generation workflows
- Modern Gradio UI
- Queue management and history tracking
- Location: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/comfy-headless

### Backpropagate
**Headless LLM Fine-Tuning Framework**
- Simple Python API with smart defaults
- Multi-run SLAO training
- GGUF export for Ollama/llama.cpp
- Full Windows + WSL2 support
- Production-grade error handling
- Location: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/backpropagate

## Code Analysis & Development

### Dev-Brain
**AI-Powered Code Analysis MCP Server**
- Test generation (unit, integration, e2e)
- Security audits and vulnerability detection
- Refactoring suggestions
- Code health scoring (49 detection patterns)
- Multi-language support (Python, JS/TS, PowerShell, CSS, HTML)
- Location: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/dev-brain

### Integradio
**Vector-Embedded Gradio Components**
- Semantic codebase navigation
- AI-native UI components
- Context-aware search in Gradio interfaces
- Location: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop/integradio

## Architecture Principles

1. **Local-First**: All tools run on local infrastructure (RTX 5080 optimized)
2. **Semantic Search**: HNSW + Ollama embeddings across all discovery layers
3. **Production-Ready**: Comprehensive error handling, logging, analytics
4. **Modular Design**: Tools compose together via MCP protocol
5. **FastMCP Framework**: Built on modern Python MCP SDK

## Technology Stack

- **MCP Protocol**: Model Context Protocol for tool interop
- **Embeddings**: Ollama (nomic-embed-text)
- **Vector Search**: HNSW (hnswlib)
- **Frameworks**: FastMCP, Gradio, FastAPI
- **Inference**: ComfyUI, TensorRT, vLLM
- **Languages**: Python 3.11+, PowerShell, TypeScript

## Integration Patterns

```
Tool Compass (Orchestrator)
    ├── File Compass (Semantic file search)
    ├── Dev-Brain (Code analysis)
    ├── Comfy-Headless (Image/video generation)
    ├── Backpropagate (Model fine-tuning)
    └── Integradio (UI components)
```

## Use Cases

**For AI Agents:**
- Discover tools by intent, not memory (Tool Compass)
- Navigate codebases semantically (File Compass)
- Generate test suites automatically (Dev-Brain)
- Create visual assets on-demand (Comfy-Headless)

**For Developers:**
- Build production MCP servers (architecture patterns)
- Integrate semantic search into applications
- Fine-tune models for specific domains
- Automate code quality workflows

## Performance Characteristics

- **Tool Discovery**: <20ms average latency
- **File Search**: <100ms for 10k+ file codebases
- **Image Generation**: 2-3x speedup with TensorRT
- **Code Analysis**: 49 patterns, 11 categories

## Getting Started

1. Install Tool Compass for unified discovery
2. Configure backends (bridge, doc, voice, comfy, video, chat)
3. Use semantic search to find tools by intent
4. Compose workflows across multiple MCP servers

## Repository Standards

All repositories follow:
- Comprehensive READMEs with quickstart
- llms.txt for AI context
- Semantic versioning (tags)
- GitHub Actions CI/CD
- Production-grade error handling
- Detailed API documentation

## Community & Support

- Organization: https://github.com/mcp-tool-shop
- Issues: Individual repo issue trackers
- Philosophy: Syntropy above all else

Each repository has its own license - check individual repos for details.
